alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 11:03AM EST until January 13 at 7:27PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Caribou ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Penobscot At Bangor affecting Penobscot County. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot at Bangor. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Bangor Waterfront begins to flood in portions of the riverwalk. Flood control systems and barriers in Kenduskeag Plaza may become stressed. At 14.0 feet, High water levels in the Kenduskeag Plaza channel. Catch basins and stormwater systems begin backing up into Kenduskeag Plaza parking areas and lowest levels of parking garages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 13.6 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.6 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 01/10/2024. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM EST.
